title: Weeping willow
viewing_guidelines: Aboriginal and Islander viewers should note this work may contain images of deceased people and caution should be exercised when viewing.
subject_group: Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Death
Family, Gender Identity, Relationships & Sexuality/Mothers and sons
abstract: His dancing is like the wind through the willow trees
description: She once described his dancing as being like the wind through the willow trees. She was his mentor and his best friend. She was his mum. Weeping Willow is the story of a dancer coming to terms with the death of his closest friend and biggest fan. It documents their journey to the present and into the future. Features Gary Lang, Marilyn Miller, Lydia Miller, Joel Donahue Contains some b&w images
part_of_compliation_title_or_vod_package: Compilation title; B2000619; AFTRS Indigenous student productions collection; Active; 1989-2005
active_carriers_public_types_and_formats: MPEG-2 Digital File; Memory Grid Pod Full Encode
